author: etan_status
content:
You can also just "exploit" this anytime the light client is more than a sync committee period behind.
In reality, the light client should employ some protections against this, like retrying to get better updates for a bit. 
If it only receives a single update with low participation, probably best to stash it away.
The spec does not define those exact heuristics for now. You can see the one that Nimbus empoys here: 
https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/595701319793377299/957891212432531486

author: ralexstokes
content: and in the limit we would want various implementations to run different heuristics!

author: ralexstokes
content:
<@563394111214714881> what you are describing is basically an "eclipse" attack and if you have an insufficient view of the network then there is not much the light client can do to recover

light clients can use various heuristics like <@881905303011086387> suggests to manage the data they get when exposing a view to users, and also i'd say if your light client has poor connectivity then it should surface a warning to user
